intro: Anisochilus carnosus var. villosior, commonly known as the hairy anisochilus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered greenish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and ornamental qualities make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
